chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
T: cpo
s2: Pred T
s1: Pred T

Goal:
chain_closed s1 -> chain_closed s2 -> chain_closed (PredI s1 s2)

Premises:
Pred = fun T : Type => T -> Prop : Type -> Type Arguments Pred _%type_scope
chain_closed = [Pred s | bot \In s /\ (forall d : chain T, d <=p s -> lim d \In s)] : Simpl_Pred (Pred T)
PredI = fun (T : Type) (p1 p2 : Pred T) => [Pred x | xPredI p1 p2 x] : forall T : Type, Pred T -> Pred T -> Simpl_Pred T Arguments PredI {T}%type_scope
chain_clos_mono : forall s1 s2 : Pred T, s1 <=p s2 -> chain_closure s1 <=p chain_closure s2
sup_clos_mono : forall (T : lattice) (s1 s2 : Pred T), s1 <=p s2 -> sup_closure s1 <=p sup_closure s2
supE : forall (T : lattice) (s1 s2 : Pred T), s1 =p s2 -> sup s1 = sup s2
sup_mono : forall (T : lattice) (s1 s2 : Pred T), s1 <=p s2 -> sup s1 <== sup s2
chain_clos_idemp : forall s : Pred T, chain_closed s -> chain_closure s =p s
chain_closP : forall s : Pred T, chain_closed (chain_closure s)
chain_clos_min : forall (s : Pred T) (t : Pred_Class), s <=p t -> chain_closed t -> chain_closure s <=p t
chain_closure = fun s : Pred T => [Pred p | forall t : Pred T, s <=p t -> chain_closed t -> p \In t] : Pred T -> Simpl_Pred T
Image' : forall A B : Type, Pred A -> (A -> B) -> Pred B
fun_sup : forall (A : Type) (B : lattice), Pred (A -> B) -> A -> B
fun_of_Pred : forall T : Type, Pred T -> T -> Prop
Lattice.mx_sup : forall T : poset, Lattice.mixin_of T -> Pred T -> T
LatticeMixin : forall (T : poset) (mx_sup : Pred T -> T), (forall (s : Pred T) (x : T), x \In s -> x <== mx_sup s) -> (forall (s : Pred T) (x : T), (forall y : T, y \In s -> y <== x) -> mx_sup s <== x) -> Lattice.mixin_of T
isMem : forall T pT : Type, (pT -> T -> Prop) -> (pT -> Mem_Pred T) -> Prop
fun_supM : forall (A : Type) (B : lattice) (s : Pred (A -> B)) (p : A -> B), (forall q : A -> B, q \In s -> q <== p) -> fun_sup s <== p
eqfun : forall A B : Type, (B -> A) -> (B -> A) -> Prop
sub_sup : forall (T : lattice) (s : Pred T), sup_closed s -> Pred (subPoset s) -> subPoset s
fun_leq : forall (A : Type) (B : poset), (A -> B) -> (A -> B) -> Prop
PropPredType : forall (T Pred_Sort : Type) (toPred : Pred_Sort -> Pred T), {mem : Pred_Sort -> Mem_Pred T | isMem toPred mem} -> PredType T
image_spec_ind : forall (A B : Type) (P : Pred A) (f : A -> B) (b : B) (P0 : Prop), (forall a : A, b = f a -> a \In P -> P0) -> image_spec P f b -> P0
image_spec_sind : forall (A B : Type) (P : Pred A) (f : A -> B) (b : B) (P0 : SProp), (forall a : A, b = f a -> a \In P -> P0) -> image_spec P f b -> P0
PosetMixin : forall (T : Type) (mx_leq : T -> T -> Prop), (forall x : T, mx_leq x x) -> (forall x y : T, mx_leq x y -> mx_leq y x -> x = y) -> (forall x y z : T, mx_leq x y -> mx_leq y z -> mx_leq x z) -> Poset.mixin_of T
Preim = fun (T rT : Type) (f : T -> rT) (d : Pred rT) => [Pred x | xPreim f d x] : forall T rT : Type, (T -> rT) -> Pred rT -> Simpl_Pred T Arguments Preim {T rT}%type_scope _%function_scope
fun_supP : forall (A : Type) (B : lattice) (s : Pred (A -> B)) (p : A -> B), p \In s -> p <== fun_sup s
fun_lim : forall (A : Type) (B : cpo), chain [posetofA -> B] -> [posetofA -> B]
comp = fun (A B C : Type) (f : B -> A) (g : C -> B) (x : C) => f (g x) : forall A B C : Type, (B -> A) -> (C -> B) -> C -> A Arguments comp {A B C}%type_scope (_ _)%function_scope _ /
app_chain : forall (A : Type) (T : poset), chain [posetofA -> T] -> A -> chain T
sup_closure = fun (T : lattice) (s : Pred T) => [Pred p | forall t : Pred T, s <=p t -> t \In sup_closed -> p \In t] : forall T : lattice, Pred T -> Simpl_Pred T Arguments sup_closure {T}
subp_asym : forall (T : Type) (p1 p2 : Pred T), p1 <=p p2 -> p2 <=p p1 -> p1 =p p2
fun_limM : forall (A : Type) (B : cpo) (s : chain [posetofA -> B]) (x : [posetofA -> B]), (forall y : [posetofA -> B], y \In s -> y <== x) -> fun_lim s <== x
